channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: "We are defending our home." Ukraine’s ambassador to Washington on Thursday said her country does "not expect anyone to fight for us," adding that at least 40 Ukrainian troops have already been killed by Russia, along with "dozens" of Ukrainian civilians. https://t.co/0S9wES6As2

Ukraine’s ambassador to the U.S., Oksana Markarova, said that hospitals and the sealed Chernobyl nuclear disaster site were among the areas hit by Russian forces. “We will defend our country, and we are not scared,” she said. https://t.co/ATx9UogKws https://t.co/tVGY2Cioho

Prime Minister Boris Johnson said Britain would impose more sanctions against Russian banks, companies and oligarchs; restrict technology exports into Russia; and ban Russia's airline in retaliation for the invasion of Ukraine.
Follow the latest. https://t.co/cySpWsmzy1 https://t.co/qelVizajWk

Breaking News: A jury found three former Minneapolis police officers guilty of violating George Floyd’s civil rights during the arrest that killed him, by failing to intervene when Derek Chauvin pressed his knee on Floyd's neck for over nine minutes. https://t.co/SzLJEdWZYK

The Russian invasion of Ukraine is threatening to cut off some international shipments of wheat. Russia and Ukraine together produce nearly a quarter of the world’s wheat, feeding billions of people. https://t.co/w3fk9HzdJy

Here's what the first day of Russia's invasion of Ukraine looked like around the country. The attack left dozens dead and drew new sanctions that President Biden said would buckle Russia’s economy. Follow live updates as the fighting continues. https://t.co/dQyc5v1EbW https://t.co/e7Men35AJa

The Pentagon is sending an additional 7,000 troops to Europe, the Pentagon said on Thursday. The defense secretary ordered the deployment of an armored brigade combat team to Germany to reassure NATO allies, the Pentagon said in a statement. https://t.co/BDQCoyFsWn

About 2,500 people gathered at the Brandenburg Gate in Berlin on Thursday to protest against the Russian invasion. For the second time this week, the city had illuminated the landmark in blue and yellow to express solidarity with Ukraine.
Follow updates: https://t.co/hKLhojLcq4 https://t.co/XH3ax96Q36

Oxxxymiron, one of Russia’s most popular rappers, called for an antiwar movement to be created in Russia. “This is a crime and a catastrophe,” he said, adding that he will cancel his six sold-out concerts in Moscow and St. Petersburg. https://t.co/rWErwXnT7f https://t.co/rSH9fAKfLs
Russia's invasion will upend the lives of 44 million Ukrainians. But effects of the attack on Ukraine, on the edge of Europe, will extend far beyond its borders. https://t.co/sffJnW9gRd

Ukraine’s ambassador to Washington on Thursday said her country does "not expect anyone to fight for us," adding that at least 40 Ukrainian troops have already been killed by Russia, along with "dozens" of Ukrainian civilians. https://t.co/jRsjrHmLI0 https://t.co/5p9y6nFPex

Ukrainians living across Europe watched in horror as Russia’s invasion of their home country began. "The whole world knows about it, and no one is doing anything," said Inna Tereshchuk, who has family members in Ukraine. https://t.co/IetYXDwdQq

Breaking News: In his first public remarks since Russia's assault on Ukraine began, President Biden emphasized again that American troops were “not going to Europe to fight in Ukraine,” but said that every inch of NATO territory would be defended. https://t.co/U5BlJ15gy1 https://t.co/oJlHGNthus

More than 40 Ukrainian soldiers have been killed and dozens wounded after Russia attacked airports and military installations in Ukraine, according to Ukrainian officials. https://t.co/hBZ9mlihnm https://t.co/hqjnyve691

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine, a former television actor and comic, has become a wartime leader, a role few expected for him. Ukrainians have rallied around him as he faces the greatest crisis in his country’s modern history. https://t.co/cdZNcfCPpv

Putin has used recent public appearances to spin out a conspiracy theory that Ukraine and the U.S. are plotting to put nuclear weapons back into Ukraine. U.S. officials have said repeatedly that they have no plans to place nuclear weapons in the country. https://t.co/Z1jamSkNyg

Beyond the battlefield, there are economic, military and diplomatic consequences of Russia's attack on Ukraine that will reverberate around the world. Here's what could happen next in the crisis. https://t.co/iI6vixloOV https://t.co/3GgzXUwFLs

Thousands of protesters took to the streets of Russian cities on Thursday to protest President Vladimir Putin’s decision to invade Ukraine. The police detained more than 600 people in Moscow alone, according to a rights group. https://t.co/iaolQ8JiZX https://t.co/qNGBmx4yjn

A day after Donald Trump called President Vladimir Putin's aggression toward Ukraine "genius" — and hours before the invasion began — Trump again praised the cunning of the Russian leader while lashing out at President Biden. https://t.co/5CPStpH2Rs

The U.S. intelligence community successfully unearthed Russia’s secret planning and accurately predicted President Vladimir Putin’s intentions to invade Ukraine, stripping the Russian leader of his capacity to go to war on a false pretext. https://t.co/ZPIx6fcy00

Russian forces captured the Chernobyl power plant north of Kyiv, the site of the 1986 nuclear disaster, “after a fierce battle,” an adviser to the Ukrainian president’s office said. He said the condition of its nuclear waste storage facilities was unknown. https://t.co/1OjZWzH1pF

Ukrainians waited to hand in their documents and complete medical checks as they volunteer for the military at a center in Kramatorsk, eastern Ukraine. The nation's defense minister has urged anyone with a Ukrainian passport to enlist. https://t.co/cYF6fIoH7u https://t.co/RTv2HOoCQ3

Chuhuyiv, in eastern Ukraine, was hit by bombs Thursday as Russian military forces attacked the country from several directions. Firefighters raced to extinguish a fire, first aid responders administered to the injured and residents mourned the dead. https://t.co/cn1B4uOWyD https://t.co/TrnQY96sw6

Many Russians saw President Vladimir Putin as calm and pragmatic. They awoke in shock to find he’d launched a full-scale assault on Ukraine. "Everything that we believed turned out to be wrong," one analyst said. https://t.co/SY4gL6HKJv

President Biden is expected to describe the Russian invasion of Ukraine as an “unprovoked and unjustified attack” during a speech from the White House at 12:30 p.m. Eastern. Biden is likely to describe President Putin’s actions as “a premeditated war.” https://t.co/RQwkCdlR3K

People have gathered around the world to protest against Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
“I just felt I was useless sitting at home watching the news,” one Ukrainian demonstrator said. https://t.co/c6wKWxqIzJ https://t.co/ozGheBqOwM

Police officers were seen detaining a woman in Moscow on Thursday during a protest against Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
Follow live updates on the crisis. https://t.co/N7m5RjkAxq https://t.co/yNMlYdmk6T

Russian military forces are moving to decapitate the Ukrainian government in Kyiv, the Pentagon said on Thursday, in a grim assessment of the first stages of President Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine. https://t.co/8Xy2qY2vfl https://t.co/0jZdvO3HR1

Several prominent figures in Russia spoke out against President Vladimir Putin's decision to invade Ukraine. Yelena Kovalskaya, director of the Meyerhold Center, a state-run theater in Moscow, said she had resigned from her post. https://t.co/868spXnHW8 https://t.co/ueAqwyQmfr

The Fox News host Tucker Carlson questioned why Americans hated President Vladimir Putin in a recent segment. The rhetoric from some of Fox's prime-time opinion programs stood in contrast to the reporting from the network’s own journalists. https://t.co/pVORtuEXl2

A Ukrainian Armed Forces aircraft was shot down in the Kyiv region, according to Ukrainian officials. Dozens of Ukrainian soldiers have been killed since Russia launched a military assault, the government said.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/18Mj4xCkqR https://t.co/IXDF5DQ0Vg

Russia's attack on Ukraine has hit major cities and airports across the country, with shelling in more than a dozen cities and towns, including outside the capital, Kyiv. https://t.co/b0Pmm02CDA https://t.co/WXqBBbsDvo

Hundreds of protesters gathered outside Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s office, waving Ukrainian flags and demanding stricter sanctions and broader action from Britain in response to Russia’s military action. https://t.co/TUmFNNBQ31 https://t.co/J7ZxiZw2rH

Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelensky, said on Twitter that Russian forces were trying to seize Chernobyl, the site of the worst nuclear accident in history. “This is a declaration of war against the whole of Europe,” he said. https://t.co/2xkdcKe1ne

Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second-largest city, has been a major target of Russia.
Closer to Russia than any other large Ukrainian city, Kharkiv has a key role in the Kremlin’s version of history and President Vladimir Putin’s view that Ukraine is part of Russia. https://t.co/Tc6vyxO3bw

President Vladimir Putin threatened “consequences you have never faced in your history” for “anyone who tries to interfere with us.” His speech, intended to justify the invasion of Ukraine, seemed to come close to threatening nuclear war. https://t.co/98DJWNFYOo https://t.co/AEUXpmJ2Uy

UEFA, European soccer’s governing body, decided to strip St. Petersburg, Russia, of the right to host the Champions League final, the biggest club game of the year, after Russia invaded Ukraine. https://t.co/m3KiHqInXo

Ukraine’s government vowed an “all-out defense” as Russia attacked more than a dozen cities and towns across the country from land, air and sea.
Follow our live updates. https://t.co/sKxri025am

Breaking News: Oil hit $105 a barrel, natural gas prices soared and the S&P 500 slid 2.5% as global markets reeled after Russia invaded Ukraine. In Moscow, stocks collapsed and the ruble fell to a record low against the U.S. dollar. https://t.co/A5LX8839gf

Video footage verified by The New York Times captures the most intense fighting seen so far near Ukraine’s capital, Kyiv. It shows Russian helicopters attacking an airport, and appears to show at least one being shot down. https://t.co/OdphCXewKl

These are some of the first images of Russian troops entering Ukraine, verified by The New York Times.
Footage captured by security cameras at a border crossing on Thursday morning shows Russian military vehicles entering from Crimea. https://t.co/w1J4OsXVYi https://t.co/QJu38aW9Jm

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine severed diplomatic ties with Russia as his country faced a wide-scale military attack.
He spoke as one of his advisers announced that more than 40 Ukrainian soldiers had died and dozens were wounded. https://t.co/WT2JCJ311k https://t.co/0tPQTYORxK

Russia began invading Ukraine early Thursday morning, with shelling and rocket attacks on several major cities including the capital, Kyiv.
Here’s a look at the attack, how it came to this point and what happens next. https://t.co/5REhLovamJ

Chuhuyiv, in eastern Ukraine, was hit by bombs as Russian forces attacked the country from several directions.
Firefighters raced to extinguish a fire, first aid responders cared for the injured and residents mourned the dead. https://t.co/HQBAw7BKGb https://t.co/6tsKC4YQBD
Aleksei Navalny, the jailed Russian opposition politician, condemned the invasion of Ukraine at a court hearing on Thursday. https://t.co/yJHnWkXdyN https://t.co/E2DpLxzWC5

As Russia began its invasion of Ukraine, lines of cars moved out of the capital, Kyiv, many heading west and hoping to find safety in parts of the country closer to Poland and NATO troops.
Follow live updates. https://t.co/kxpyE5YuYP https://t.co/9XBzrdTyVw

U.S. troops are preparing to move closer to Poland’s border with Ukraine to help process people fleeing after Russia invaded Ukraine, an Army spokesman said. https://t.co/PuOshlsecz https://t.co/aelsnxnnDy

Ukraine's military claimed to have shot down several Russian military aircraft as the country entered "all-out defense mode."
More than 40 Ukrainian soldiers were killed and dozens wounded on Thursday morning, an adviser to Ukraine's president said. https://t.co/ruoKNuKrhV

Video on Thursday showed burning apartment buildings near Kharkiv, Ukraine’s second largest city. The footage is evidence of a possible attack on civilian infrastructure. https://t.co/RuuvTtW1TI https://t.co/pSBq6hNnGj

Long lines formed at a bus station in Kyiv after Russian attacks were launched across Ukraine. Residents waited in line for up to an hour to buy fuel. The city’s main airport was bombed and its major roads were jammed with traffic as people fled. https://t.co/wunOx67CpZ https://t.co/h4VsK1EcWq
